### 2. *A* and *B* are two events. Show that <img src="http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%24P%28A%20%5Ccup%20B%29%3DP%28A%29%2BP%28B%29-P%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%24&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0" align="center" border="0" alt="$P(A \cup B)=P(A)+P(B)-P(A \cap B)$" width="268" height="18" />.

To start with,\
<img src="http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%24%24A%20%5Ccup%20B%3D%28A-B%29%20%5Ccup%20%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%20%5Ccup%20%28B-A%29%24%24%5C&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0" align="center" border="0" alt="$$A \cup B=(A-B) \cup (A \cap B) \cup (B-A)$$\" width="274" height="18" />

And by the property regarding probability of events,\

<img src="http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%24%24P%28A%20%5Ccup%20B%29%3DP%28A-B%29%2BP%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%2BP%28B-A%29%24%24%5C%0A&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0" align="center" border="0" alt="$$P(A \cup B)=P(A-B)+P(A \cap B)+P(B-A)$$\" width="335" height="18" />

While <img src="http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%24P%28A-B%29%3DP%28A%29-P%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%24&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0" align="center" border="0" alt="$P(A-B)=P(A)-P(A \cap B)$" width="171" height="18" /> and <img src="http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%24P%28B-A%29%3DP%28B%29-P%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%24%5C&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0" align="center" border="0" alt="$P(B-A)=P(B)-P(A \cap B)$\" width="172" height="18" />,\

<img src="http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%24%24%5Cbegin%7Baligned%7D%0AP%28A%20%5Ccup%20B%29%26%3DP%28A%29-P%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%2BP%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%2BP%28B%29-P%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%5C%5C%0A%26%3DP%28A%29%2BP%28B%29-P%28A%20%5Ccap%20B%29%0A%5Cend%7Baligned%7D%24%24%5C&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0" align="center" border="0" alt="$$\begin{aligned}P(A \cup B)&=P(A)-P(A \cap B)+P(A \cap B)+P(B)-P(A \cap B)\\&=P(A)+P(B)-P(A \cap B)\end{aligned}$$\" width="443" height="43" />
